Service: Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra

Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for database capacity, performance, scalability, and redundancy. Identify the applications and services that will use the database.
Design the database architecture, including keyspaces, replication strategies, and integration with existing systems.
Create and configure the Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell.
Set up keyspaces and tables based on the application requirements. Define partition keys and clustering columns for optimal performance.
Enable security features such as encryption at rest, encryption in transit, and role-based access control (RBAC). Configure firewall rules and private endpoints.
Configure automated backups and test restore procedures to ensure data resiliency.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and other tools to track database performance, availability, and errors.
Perform load testing and query performance testing to ensure the database meets the required specifications.
Document the database architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training for the operations team.
Ensure the database setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
